title: Ephesians Chapter 6 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Ephesians chapter 6 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Ephesians Chapter 6 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Ephesians Chapter 6.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 6:1, who should children obey?
options: Their parents
Their teachers
Their friends
Their neighbors
questions.correctAnswer: Their parents
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:1 instructs children to obey their parents in the Lord, indicating the importance of parental obedience.

questions.question: What is described as the first commandment with promise in Ephesians 6?
options: Thou shalt not steal
Honour thy father and mother
Thou shalt not kill
Remember the sabbath day
questions.correctAnswer: Honour thy father and mother
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:2 states that 'Honour thy father and mother' is the first commandment with promise.

questions.question: What is promised to those who honour their father and mother according to Ephesians 6:3?
options: Great wealth
That it may be well with thee, and thou mayest live long on the earth
Fame and glory
A place in heaven
questions.correctAnswer: That it may be well with thee, and thou mayest live long on the earth
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:3 promises well-being and long life on earth to those who honour their parents.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 6:4, what should fathers avoid doing to their children?
options: Provoke them to wrath
Teach them the Lord's ways
Provide for their needs
Love them unconditionally
questions.correctAnswer: Provoke them to wrath
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:4 instructs fathers not to provoke their children to anger but to nurture and admonish them in the Lord.

questions.question: In Ephesians 6:5, servants are told to obey their masters how?
options: With fear and trembling, as unto Christ
Only when watched
Only if it benefits them
Without any respect
questions.correctAnswer: With fear and trembling, as unto Christ
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:5 says servants should obey their masters with fear and trembling, as if serving Christ Himself.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 6:7, how should servants do their service?
options: With good will, as to the Lord
Only when commanded
For personal gain
With complaints
questions.correctAnswer: With good will, as to the Lord
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:7 teaches servants to serve with goodwill, doing service as unto the Lord and not men.

questions.question: What does Ephesians 6:8 say about the reward for good deeds?
options: Only masters reward good deeds
Good deeds go unnoticed
The Lord will reward every good thing done
Good deeds are rewarded by friends
questions.correctAnswer: The Lord will reward every good thing done
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:8 promises that the Lord will reward every good deed, whether the person is bond or free.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 6:9, what should masters avoid doing to their servants?
options: Giving them rest
Threatening them
Feeding them
Praising them
questions.correctAnswer: Threatening them
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:9 instructs masters not to threaten their servants, recognizing that their Master is also in heaven.

questions.question: What does Ephesians 6:10 encourage believers to be strong in?
options: The Lord and the power of His might
Their own strength
Physical power
Wealth and status
questions.correctAnswer: The Lord and the power of His might
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:10 urges believers to be strong in the Lord and in the power of His might.

questions.question: What is the 'whole armour' mentioned in Ephesians 6:11 meant to help believers stand against?
options: The wiles of the devil
Physical enemies
Natural disasters
Worldly wealth
questions.correctAnswer: The wiles of the devil
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:11 advises believers to put on the whole armour of God to stand against the devil's schemes.

questions.question: True or False: Ephesians 6:12 says we wrestle against flesh and blood.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:12 clearly states that we do not wrestle against flesh and blood but against spiritual rulers and wickedness.

questions.question: True or False: Ephesians 6:16 advises taking the shield of faith to quench fiery darts.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:16 instructs believers to take the shield of faith to extinguish all the fiery darts of the wicked.

questions.question: True or False: Ephesians 6:18 encourages praying always with all prayer and supplication in the Spirit.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:18 encourages constant prayer with all kinds of prayers and supplications in the Spirit.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Ephesians 6:14: 'Stand therefore, having your loins girt about with ______,'
options: truth
faith
hope
love
questions.correctAnswer: truth
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:14 instructs believers to stand with their loins girt about with truth.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 6:15, what should believers have on their feet?
options: The preparation of the gospel of peace
Sandals of gold
Boots of strength
Shoes of righteousness
questions.correctAnswer: The preparation of the gospel of peace
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:15 says believers should have their feet shod with the preparation of the gospel of peace.

medium.title: Ephesians Chapter 6 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Ephesians Chapter 6 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Ephesians 6:1-3 teach us about the importance of family relationships?
options: Children should obey and honor their parents because it brings a promise of well-being and long life
Parents should always give children whatever they want
Children can choose whether or not to obey their parents without consequences
Honoring parents is optional in the Lord
questions.correctAnswer: Children should obey and honor their parents because it brings a promise of well-being and long life
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:1-3 instructs children to obey and honor their parents, highlighting that this is right and includes a promise of well-being and long life. This emphasizes the biblical virtue of respect within the family.

questions.question: What guidance does Ephesians 6:4 give to fathers about raising their children?
options: Fathers should nurture and admonish their children in the Lord and avoid provoking them to anger
Fathers should discipline children harshly to ensure obedience
Fathers should leave children to raise themselves
Fathers should prioritize work over family
questions.correctAnswer: Fathers should nurture and admonish their children in the Lord and avoid provoking them to anger
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:4 teaches fathers to avoid provoking their children to wrath but to bring them up with nurture and admonition in the Lord, promoting a loving and godly family environment.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 6:5-8, how should servants (employees) view their work?
options: They should serve with sincerity as if serving Christ, not merely to please men
They should only work when being watched
They should obey masters only when convenient
They are free to ignore masters if they disagree
questions.correctAnswer: They should serve with sincerity as if serving Christ, not merely to please men
questions.explanation: Verses 5-8 encourage servants to obey with respect and sincerity, doing the will of God from the heart as if serving Christ, which teaches integrity and faithfulness in work.

questions.question: What instruction does Ephesians 6:9 offer to masters (employers) regarding how they should treat their servants?
options: Masters should treat servants without threats, recognizing God as their Master in heaven
Masters should demand obedience through fear
Masters have no responsibility toward servants
Masters should favor some servants over others
questions.correctAnswer: Masters should treat servants without threats, recognizing God as their Master in heaven
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:9 calls masters to fairness and forbearing threatening, acknowledging that their ultimate Master is God who shows no partiality, thus teaching humility and justice in leadership.

questions.question: What does Paul mean by telling believers to be strong in the Lord and in the power of His might (Ephesians 6:10)?
options: Believers should rely on God's strength rather than their own to face spiritual challenges
Believers should depend on personal strength alone
Believers should avoid all difficulties
Believers must earn strength through works
questions.correctAnswer: Believers should rely on God's strength rather than their own to face spiritual challenges
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:10 emphasizes relying on God's power to be strong, teaching faith and trust in divine strength to endure trials and spiritual battles.

questions.question: What is the purpose of putting on the whole armour of God as described in Ephesians 6:11-13?
options: To stand against the devil's schemes and remain firm in faith during evil times
To become physically invincible
To isolate oneself from others
To gain worldly power
questions.correctAnswer: To stand against the devil's schemes and remain firm in faith during evil times
questions.explanation: Verses 11-13 explain that the spiritual armor equips believers to resist the devil's deceptions and to stand firm in faith, highlighting perseverance through spiritual warfare.

questions.question: Which piece of the armour of God represents truth according to Ephesians 6:14?
options: The girdle (belt) of truth
The breastplate of righteousness
The shield of faith
The helmet of salvation
questions.correctAnswer: The girdle (belt) of truth
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:14 describes standing with loins girt about with truth, symbolizing truth as foundational for spiritual readiness and integrity.

questions.question: How does Ephesians 6:15 describe the readiness believers should have?
options: Having feet shod with the preparation of the gospel of peace
Wearing shoes of wealth and comfort
Avoiding all conflict
Ignoring the gospel message
questions.correctAnswer: Having feet shod with the preparation of the gospel of peace
questions.explanation: Verse 15 teaches believers to be prepared to share the gospel of peace, emphasizing readiness to evangelize and maintain peace.

questions.question: What is the significance of the shield of faith as explained in Ephesians 6:16?
options: It enables believers to extinguish all the fiery darts of the wicked
It protects only from physical harm
It is a symbol of human wisdom
It is unnecessary in spiritual battles
questions.correctAnswer: It enables believers to extinguish all the fiery darts of the wicked
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:16 highlights faith as a protective shield against spiritual attacks, teaching trust in God to overcome temptation and trials.

questions.question: What two items of the armour of God are named in Ephesians 6:17, and what do they represent?
options: Helmet of salvation and sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God
Helmet of wisdom and sword of courage
Helmet of righteousness and sword of faith
Helmet of peace and sword of love
questions.correctAnswer: Helmet of salvation and sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:17 describes the helmet as salvation protecting the mind, and the sword as the Spirit's weapon, which is the word of God, highlighting defense and offense in spiritual warfare.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 6:18, what spiritual disciplines should believers practice continually?
options: Praying always with all prayer and supplication in the Spirit, watching with perseverance for all saints
Fasting without prayer
Meditation without action
Avoiding prayer to focus on works
questions.correctAnswer: Praying always with all prayer and supplication in the Spirit, watching with perseverance for all saints
questions.explanation: Verse 18 calls for continual, Spirit-led prayer and vigilance with perseverance, teaching sustained spiritual devotion and intercession for others.

questions.question: True or False: Ephesians 6:8 teaches that God will reward every person for the good they do, whether they are bond or free.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:8 states that whatever good anyone does, they will receive from the Lord, emphasizing God's just and impartial reward for good deeds.

questions.question: True or False: Ephesians 6:20 shows Paul asking for boldness to speak the mystery of the gospel because he is free to travel and preach without restrictions.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:20 reveals Paul is an ambassador in bonds (imprisoned), requesting boldness to proclaim the gospel despite his circumstances, teaching courage and faithfulness in trials.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Ephesians 6:23 sends peace to the brethren and love with ___, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
options: faith
hope
charity
joy
questions.correctAnswer: faith
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:23 emphasizes peace and love combined with faith as a blessing from God the Father and Jesus Christ, highlighting spiritual unity.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with fear in their workplace. Based on Ephesians 6:5-7, what biblical truth could you share with them?
options: Serve your earthly masters with fear and sincerity as if serving Christ, which brings God's reward
Avoid work to escape fear
Only obey masters when they are kind
Fear is natural; ignore God's commands
questions.correctAnswer: Serve your earthly masters with fear and sincerity as if serving Christ, which brings God's reward
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:5-7 teaches believers to work wholeheartedly as serving Christ, encouraging faithfulness and courage even in difficult circumstances.

hard.title: Ephesians Chapter 6 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Ephesians Chapter 6.

questions.question: In Ephesians 6:1-3, Paul emphasizes children's obedience to parents as 'right' and associates it with a specific commandment. Which Old Testament commandment is referenced here?
options: The Fifth Commandment: Honour thy father and thy mother
The First Commandment: Thou shalt have no other gods before me
The Tenth Commandment: Thou shalt not covet
The Seventh Commandment: Thou shalt not commit adultery
questions.correctAnswer: The Fifth Commandment: Honour thy father and thy mother
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:2 explicitly calls this 'the first commandment with promise,' referring to Exodus 20:12, the Fifth Commandment, which commands honoring one's parents.

questions.question: The instruction to 'provoke not your children to wrath' in Ephesians 6:4 employs a Greek term often translated as 'provoke' or 'exasperate.' What is the significance of this term in the context of ancient Greco-Roman family dynamics?
options: It warns fathers against harsh discipline that could lead to rebellion
It encourages fathers to publicly shame their children
It instructs fathers to be indifferent to their children’s behavior
It commands fathers to prioritize legal authority over nurturing
questions.correctAnswer: It warns fathers against harsh discipline that could lead to rebellion
questions.explanation: In the Greco-Roman context, paternal authority was strong, but Paul cautions against provoking children to anger, likely to prevent resentment or rebellion (Ephesians 6:4).

questions.question: How does the concept of 'servants obeying masters with singleness of heart as unto Christ' in Ephesians 6:5-7 reflect a deeper theological principle found elsewhere in the New Testament?
options: It parallels Colossians 3:22-24, emphasizing service to Christ over human masters
It contradicts Jesus' teachings on servant leadership in Matthew 20
It is unique to Ephesians with no clear New Testament parallel
It refers exclusively to Jewish slaves and has no broader application
questions.correctAnswer: It parallels Colossians 3:22-24, emphasizing service to Christ over human masters
questions.explanation: Paul's instruction echoes Colossians 3:22-24, where believers are exhorted to serve earthly masters sincerely as serving Christ, indicating a spiritual motivation behind social obedience (Ephesians 6:5-7).

questions.question: In Ephesians 6:8, Paul assures servants that 'whatsoever good thing any man doeth, the same shall he receive of the Lord.' How does this statement connect with the principle of divine recompense found in the Old Testament?
options: It echoes Deuteronomy 7:9 where God rewards those who love Him
It contradicts the Old Testament teaching of retribution
It aligns with the concept of merit-based salvation in Leviticus
It is a novel Christian doctrine without Old Testament roots
questions.correctAnswer: It echoes Deuteronomy 7:9 where God rewards those who love Him
questions.explanation: The promise of receiving good from the Lord for good works resonates with Deuteronomy 7:9, which emphasizes God's faithfulness in rewarding love and obedience (Ephesians 6:8).

questions.question: Ephesians 6:9 instructs masters to forbear threatening because 'your Master also is in heaven.' What is the theological implication of this statement in the context of social hierarchies of the ancient world?
options: It asserts divine accountability transcending earthly authority
It encourages masters to increase their earthly power
It suggests masters are exempt from judgment
It promotes social rebellion against masters
questions.correctAnswer: It asserts divine accountability transcending earthly authority
questions.explanation: Paul reminds masters that their ultimate Master is God in heaven, implying they should exercise authority justly, knowing they will be judged by God (Ephesians 6:9).

questions.question: The exhortation to 'be strong in the Lord, and in the power of his might' (Ephesians 6:10) employs a term for strength that in Greek carries what nuance?
options: Endurance and inner empowerment through divine enablement
Physical strength and military power
Financial wealth and political influence
Emotional resilience independent of God
questions.correctAnswer: Endurance and inner empowerment through divine enablement
questions.explanation: The Greek word for 'strong' (endunamoo) implies being empowered and enabled by God's might, not merely physical or external strength (Ephesians 6:10).

questions.question: The 'whole armour of God' described in Ephesians 6:11-17 is a rich metaphor. Which Old Testament warrior imagery is most closely paralleled here?
options: The armor of a Roman soldier, reflecting cultural context and Psalm 18 imagery
The armor of King Saul during his battles
The shepherd's staff and sling of David
The chariot and horses used by Elijah
questions.correctAnswer: The armor of a Roman soldier, reflecting cultural context and Psalm 18 imagery
questions.explanation: Paul uses the Roman soldier's armor imagery, familiar to his audience, while also echoing Psalm 18's descriptions of divine protection and righteousness as armor (Ephesians 6:11-17).

questions.question: Ephesians 6:12 describes the spiritual conflict as against 'principalities, against powers, against the rulers of the darkness of this world.' How does this language reflect Jewish apocalyptic thought?
options: It aligns with intertestamental literature depicting cosmic spiritual forces opposing God
It is a purely Hellenistic philosophical concept
It denies the existence of spiritual beings
It refers only to human political leaders
questions.correctAnswer: It aligns with intertestamental literature depicting cosmic spiritual forces opposing God
questions.explanation: The description matches Jewish apocalyptic motifs, such as in Daniel and Enoch, where cosmic powers and principalities represent spiritual evil opposing God's kingdom (Ephesians 6:12).

questions.question: The 'breastplate of righteousness' and 'helmet of salvation' in Ephesians 6:14-17 symbolize what in biblical typology?
options: Righteous living and assurance of salvation protecting the believer
Literal metal armor worn by Israelite priests
Only external observance of the law
Weapons used in Old Testament wars
questions.correctAnswer: Righteous living and assurance of salvation protecting the believer
questions.explanation: These pieces of armor symbolize spiritual virtues: righteousness guards the heart like a breastplate, and salvation protects the mind like a helmet (Ephesians 6:14-17).

questions.question: In Ephesians 6:17, the 'sword of the Spirit' is identified as the 'word of God.' How does this metaphor relate to Jesus’ usage of Scripture during his temptation in the wilderness?
options: Jesus used Scripture as a weapon against Satan, paralleling the 'sword of the Spirit'
Jesus rejected Scripture during his temptation
Jesus used physical violence instead of words
The metaphor is unrelated to Jesus’ ministry
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus used Scripture as a weapon against Satan, paralleling the 'sword of the Spirit'
questions.explanation: Jesus’ responses to Satan’s temptations were all Scripture quotations (Matthew 4), showing the word of God as a spiritual weapon, as in Ephesians 6:17.

questions.question: Ephesians 6:18 emphasizes 'praying always with all prayer and supplication in the Spirit.' What is the significance of 'in the Spirit' in this context?
options: It indicates prayer inspired and empowered by the Holy Spirit
It means praying only in tongues
It refers to silent meditation without words
It limits prayer to formal liturgy
questions.correctAnswer: It indicates prayer inspired and empowered by the Holy Spirit
questions.explanation: 'In the Spirit' means the Holy Spirit guides, inspires, and empowers believers' prayers, enabling perseverance and intercession (Ephesians 6:18).

questions.question: Paul requests prayer for boldness to 'open my mouth' in proclaiming the gospel in Ephesians 6:19-20. How does this reflect the apostolic role in early Christian communities?
options: It shows the dependence on God for effective witness amid persecution
It reflects self-confidence without reliance on God
It indicates Paul's isolation from the church
It suggests that teaching was discouraged
questions.correctAnswer: It shows the dependence on God for effective witness amid persecution
questions.explanation: Paul’s plea for prayer underlines his reliance on divine enablement to proclaim the gospel boldly despite imprisonment and opposition (Ephesians 6:19-20).

questions.question: The sending of Tychicus in Ephesians 6:21-22 serves what purpose in the epistolary context of this letter?
options: To inform and encourage the Ephesian believers about Paul's circumstances
To deliver a legal summons against the Ephesians
To announce Paul's retirement
To bring new laws to the church
questions.correctAnswer: To inform and encourage the Ephesian believers about Paul's circumstances
questions.explanation: Tychicus is sent to update the believers on Paul's situation and to comfort their hearts, highlighting pastoral care within the early church (Ephesians 6:21-22).

questions.question: The closing benediction in Ephesians 6:23-24 combines peace, love with faith, and grace. How does this trifold blessing reflect Pauline theology?
options: It encapsulates the relational and salvific aspects of Christian life
It is a standard Jewish greeting without Christian distinctiveness
It ignores faith and focuses only on works
It excludes grace as a theological theme
questions.correctAnswer: It encapsulates the relational and salvific aspects of Christian life
questions.explanation: Paul stresses peace, love expressed with faith, and grace as foundational for believers’ relationship with God and each other, reflecting core Pauline themes (Ephesians 6:23-24).

questions.question: True or False: According to Ephesians 6:16, the 'shield of faith' is intended to extinguish all the fiery darts of the wicked.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:16 explicitly states that the shield of faith enables believers to 'quench all the fiery darts of the wicked,' emphasizing faith’s protective role.

theological.title: Ephesians Chapter 6 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Ephesians Chapter 6 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 6, what is the foundational commandment given to children regarding obedience and honor?
options: Obey your parents and honor them
Love your neighbors as yourself
Pray without ceasing
Forgive those who trespass against you
questions.correctAnswer: Obey your parents and honor them
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:1-2 commands children to obey and honor their parents, echoing the commandment with a promise found in Exodus 20:12 and Deuteronomy 5:16, affirming the importance of family order and blessing.

questions.question: What is the promised blessing associated with honoring one's father and mother as stated in Ephesians 6?
options: That you may live long on the earth and it may be well with you
That you will be wealthy and prosperous
That you will have many children
That you will be free from sickness
questions.correctAnswer: That you may live long on the earth and it may be well with you
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:3 cites the promise attached to honoring parents, consistent with the Old Testament commandment in Exodus 20:12, emphasizing God's covenantal blessing on obedience.

questions.question: What instruction does Ephesians 6 give to fathers in their relationship with their children?
options: Do not provoke your children to wrath, but bring them up in the nurture and admonition of the Lord
Discipline your children harshly to correct them
Allow children to do as they please to encourage freedom
Provide them with wealth and status
questions.correctAnswer: Do not provoke your children to wrath, but bring them up in the nurture and admonition of the Lord
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:4 instructs fathers to avoid provoking anger and instead to nurture and admonish their children according to the Lord’s teaching, reflecting God’s fatherly care (Psalm 103:13; Proverbs 22:6).

questions.question: How are servants instructed to serve their earthly masters according to Ephesians 6?
options: With fear and trembling, as to Christ, not with eye-service
Only when watched, to avoid punishment
With complaint and resistance
Only when it benefits them personally
questions.correctAnswer: With fear and trembling, as to Christ, not with eye-service
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:5-6 teaches servants to obey sincerely and reverently, as serving Christ Himself, not just to please men superficially, aligning with Colossians 3:23-24.

questions.question: What does Ephesians 6 say about the reward for good deeds done by servants, whether bond or free?
options: They will receive the same from the Lord
They will be rewarded only by their masters
They will receive no reward
They will be judged by men
questions.correctAnswer: They will receive the same from the Lord
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:8 affirms that God is the ultimate judge and rewarder of good works, highlighting divine justice and impartiality as also seen in Romans 2:6 and Galatians 6:7-8.

questions.question: What are masters instructed to do toward their servants in Ephesians 6?
options: Do the same things without threatening, knowing that their Master is in heaven
Rule with severity to maintain order
Ignore their servants’ needs
Reward only the most productive servants
questions.correctAnswer: Do the same things without threatening, knowing that their Master is in heaven
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:9 commands masters to be forbearing and fair, recognizing God as the ultimate Master who shows no partiality, consistent with James 2:1-4 and Colossians 4:1.

questions.question: What is the source of strength for believers as stated in Ephesians 6?
options: The Lord and the power of His might
Their own wisdom and strength
Wealth and status
Human alliances
questions.correctAnswer: The Lord and the power of His might
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:10 calls believers to be strong in the Lord’s power, emphasizing reliance on divine strength rather than human resources, paralleling Isaiah 40:29 and Philippians 4:13.

questions.question: What spiritual protection is a believer called to 'put on' in Ephesians 6 to stand against the devil’s schemes?
options: The whole armour of God
Physical armor and weapons
Human wisdom and strategy
Isolation from the world
questions.correctAnswer: The whole armour of God
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:11 and 6:13 urge believers to take up the full armor of God to stand firm against spiritual forces of evil, reflecting the metaphor of divine protection also found in Isaiah 59:17.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 6, against what kind of enemies do believers wrestle?
options: Principalities, powers, rulers of darkness, and spiritual wickedness in high places
Flesh and blood
Natural disasters
Political authorities only
questions.correctAnswer: Principalities, powers, rulers of darkness, and spiritual wickedness in high places
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:12 clarifies that the real battle is spiritual, against demonic forces, reflecting the cosmic spiritual conflict seen in Daniel 10 and Revelation 12.

questions.question: Which item of the armour of God is described as the 'breastplate' in Ephesians 6?
options: Righteousness
Faith
Salvation
Truth
questions.correctAnswer: Righteousness
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:14 describes the breastplate as righteousness, symbolizing the believer’s protection through justification and sanctification, consistent with Isaiah 59:17 and Romans 3:22.

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'shield of faith' described in Ephesians 6?
options: It quenches all the fiery darts of the wicked
It is a symbol of wealth
It is a defensive weapon against physical enemies
It represents human effort
questions.correctAnswer: It quenches all the fiery darts of the wicked
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:16 explains that the shield of faith protects from spiritual attacks, illustrating reliance on God’s promises as seen in Psalm 91:4 and Hebrews 11.

questions.question: What is described as the 'sword of the Spirit' in Ephesians 6?
options: The word of God
Prayer
Faith
Salvation
questions.correctAnswer: The word of God
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:17 identifies the sword of the Spirit as the word of God, emphasizing Scripture’s power in spiritual warfare, consistent with Hebrews 4:12 and Matthew 4:4.

questions.question: What attitude and practice does Ephesians 6 encourage believers to maintain in prayer?
options: Praying always with all prayer and supplication in the Spirit, watching with perseverance
Praying only on special occasions
Praying silently without involvement
Praying only for personal needs
questions.correctAnswer: Praying always with all prayer and supplication in the Spirit, watching with perseverance
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:18 commands continual, Spirit-led prayer with perseverance, reflecting Jesus’ teaching on persistent prayer (Luke 18:1) and the Spirit’s intercession (Romans 8:26).

questions.question: Who is Tychicus, mentioned in Ephesians 6, and what is his purpose?
options: A beloved brother and faithful minister sent to inform the believers of Paul's affairs and to comfort them
A Roman official overseeing the church
A false teacher to be avoided
A wealthy benefactor of the church
questions.correctAnswer: A beloved brother and faithful minister sent to inform the believers of Paul's affairs and to comfort them
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:21-22 identifies Tychicus as Paul's trusted minister sent to encourage and inform the Ephesian church, illustrating the early church's mutual care (Acts 20:4; Colossians 4:7-8).

questions.question: What final blessing does Paul give to those who love the Lord Jesus Christ in sincerity in Ephesians 6?
options: Grace
Wealth
Long life
Health
questions.correctAnswer: Grace
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6:24 concludes with a blessing of grace for all sincere believers, consistent with the New Testament emphasis on God’s unmerited favor (2 Corinthians 12:9; Romans 5:1-2).
